description: From Middle English burghbote (“the obligation to keep walls of towns or fortifications in repair; the tax levied for this purpose”), from Old English burgbōt, burhbōt (“liability for repair of the walls of a town or fortress”), equivalent to burgh +‎ bote.

entries.meaning: (obsolete) A contribution toward the building or repairing of castles or walls for the defense of a city or town.
examples: Borghbote: Refere les murs de la cite.
